targets.Name: Babybear
targets.bannerText: This carseat should face the rear.
postText: Oh my! Babybear is too young to ride facing forward in their car seat!
It’s safest for young children to ride backwards at least until they turn 2 years old.

targets.Name: Flowerbear
targets.bannerText: Both of Flowerbear's knees have to be over the seat to be safe.
postText: Flowerbear is not sitting with their knees bent over the edge of the seat.  This is not a safe way to ride in the car.
To ride safely, we should be sitting up tall, with our knees bent over the edge of the seat.

targets.Name: Bubblebear
targets.bannerText: Bubbles can distract the driver who needs to concentrate.
postText: Bubble Bear is having fun with their bubbles, but they can distract the driver.

When we are in the car, it’s important for us to be good passengers and not distract the driver.  Bubble Bear will wait to use their bubbles until they are outside of the car.  Can you think of other ways we can make sure we don’t distract the driver?
